intro: Cynoglossum sintenisii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows at high altitudes. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
